head.supplied: Hermannsburg ¶ May 22nd /93 ¶ Esteemed Baron ¶ ¶ As I have just come home from a journey to the West I have brought something back for you, too, but for the time being I am sending you first this fr...

div.p: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

MS found with a specimen of Brachychiton gregorii (MEL 71760), a species M had described in B57.07.01, p. 199, note, without certainly attributing it to Brachychiton or Delabechea; the formal name was given in B62.03.03, p. 157, citing the earlier paper. MS annotation by M: 'Beantw 15/6/93' [Answered 15/6/93; letter not found.
Numerous errors in spelling and grammar have not been noted individually except when misunderstanding could arise. Hermannsburg May 22th /93

Da ich soeben zu Haus gekommen bin von einer reise nach Westen so habe ich auch etwas für Ihnen mitgebracht, vorläufig schicke ich aber Ihnen erst diese mir ganz neue frucht Ich habe nehmlich draussen weit im Westen einen wunderschönen Baum angetroffen und dieses sind die Früchte von denselben Dieser Baum ist ein schöner gerader Baum ähnlich den Schiock hier, den dicksten stam den ich sah war ohngefähr 2½ fuss im durchmesser klatte
glatte? rinde aussehn grau, gutes schönes nicht zu hartes Holz. Herr Kempe ist da noch nicht gewesen seit meines hierseins, und ich habe 10 Jahre mit Herrn Kempe hier gearbeitet, darum denke ich es wird eine neue Sorte Bäume sein, wo ich Ihnen den Samen von schicken kan. Der Schiocksamen kommt nächste Post.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: Besten Dank für Ihre sendung Sämerei in der May Post

As I have just come home from a journey to the West I have brought something back for you, too, but for the time being I am sending you first this fruit quite new to me. Because far out in the West I have come across a wondrously beautiful tree, and these are the fruits of the same. This tree is a beautiful straight tree similar to the she-oak here, the thickest trunk I saw was approximately 2½ feet in diameter, smooth bark, appearance grey, good beautiful timber not too hard. Mr. Kempe has not yet been there since my being here, and I have worked here for 10 years with Mr. Kempe, therefore I think it will be a new sort of tree of which I can send you the seed. The she-oak seed comes next mail.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;

div.p: Best thanks for your dispatch of seed in the May mail.
